p: The antidiabetic appraisal of alcoholic leaf extract of S. media was assessed for their hyperlipidemic and hyperglycemic potential in alloxan induced diabetic mice using established documented procedures. Significant inhibitory activity was exhibited by pancreatic β-glucosidase and α-amylase. This instigated significant reduction in fasting blood sugar, serum transaminase and HbA1c (−48.4%) of tested organism when compared to control model. Also, blood glucose levels were acceptably maintained [ 48]. In a similar study, flavonoids, terpernoids, glutamic acid and arginine appraised in alcoholic leaf extract displayed significant antidiabetic effect on alloxan induced diabetic mice [ 49].
